intro: Moricandia arvensis var. suffruticosa, commonly known as the field moricandia, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming annual that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes, and its leaves are pinnately divided with a rough texture. It is often found in disturbed soils and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in arid conditions and its role in supporting pollinators.
